contentBlocks.title: Modern Contemporary Charm
contentBlocks.description: A fan of intimate and vibrant interiors? Prepare to be inspired by the natural charm of Marzipan Residence. Expansive windows, timber accents and a host of natural light - there’s plenty of details to love.

contentBlocks.caption: Homely Quarters
contentBlocks.copy: Inspired by Queensland interiors, Marzipan Residence is an undeniably warm and homely abode. Boasting effortlessly chic interiors and comfortable living, the home is enhanced with the function and aesthetics of our designer window furnishings.

contentBlocks.caption: Sheer Softness
contentBlocks.copy: Pairing with the pastel palette and natural materials of the home, our S Fold Sheer Curtains are introduced to add texture and softness to the rooms.

contentBlocks.caption: Effortless Living
contentBlocks.copy: Maintaining high function in the home our Roller Blinds in Vivid Block White and One Block White were added to promote effortlessly comfortable and practical living.

contentBlocks.caption: Designer Finishes
contentBlocks.copy: In keeping with the designer aesthetics of the space our window furnishings have been well infused through consideration and detail. Top-fitted installation, S fold curves and curved curtain tracks keep the furnishings complementary.

contentBlocks.caption: Motorised Luxury
contentBlocks.copy: Adding to the functional and homely experience, motorisation has been combined with our designer window furnishings. Introducing automation, pre-scheduled and hands-free blind and curtain adjustments.

contentBlocks.title: A renovation revolution
contentBlocks.description: This transformation like no other turned a dark, closed-off heritage bungalow into an open, bright, beachy-vibe haven for Kayla, Jae and their young family.

contentBlocks.caption: Function and form with finesse
contentBlocks.copy: Motorised curtains converted this older home into a modern wonder, allowing complete control over light and privacy with a touch of a button. Double and lined curtains designed to fit wall-to-wall provide the warmth and light control the young family need to create a cosy space that works day and night.

contentBlocks.caption: A classically modern finish with a twist
contentBlocks.copy: Pairing a beachy vision with a heritage framework called for plantation shutters that perfectly married the two aesthetics to create a seamless, stylish result. Providing both a classic look and a bright finish that lifted the living spaces, shutters were the ideal answer for this modern, warm family home that craved a luxe look within a traditional structure.

contentBlocks.caption: Smarter style choices
contentBlocks.copy: A small heritage window and sparse wall were converted into a textured feature with sheer curtains wrapping the room in gentle warmth and added softness. Diffusing natural light, the sheers were designed to both lighten and brighten throughout the home while giving the family the daytime privacy they desire.

contentBlocks.title: Modern Farmhouse Masterpiece
contentBlocks.description: Fall in instant love with the contemporary country design of the Bowral Project. Showcasing tall gabled ceilings, elongated glass walls, and a luxurious open plan dining/living area.

contentBlocks.caption: Chic Palette & Considerations
contentBlocks.copy: Our Sheer Curtains and Roller Blinds are curated to further the chic and vibrant palette of the home. Meticulous considerations such as fit and track keep the furnishings effortlessly integrated into the space.

contentBlocks.caption: Clever Design Features
contentBlocks.copy: A design feature of its own, our Sheer Curtains in Allusion Snow are face fitted to match the height of the space and perfectly frame the gabled ceilings. The curtain track and curved track design then further the linear and architectural elements in the home.

contentBlocks.caption: High-Performing Function
contentBlocks.copy: Layering our sheers with Blockout Roller Blinds in Kew Natural helps provide both undeniable aesthetics and high-performing function in the space. Sheers keep the rooms soft and plush while the blinds provide complete privacy and light control options.

contentBlocks.caption: Effortless Motorisation
contentBlocks.copy: Keeping to the innately luxe design of the home, motorisation is introduced to allow for hands-free window furnishing adjustments. Achieving functional luxury is made easy with automation and remote function.

contentBlocks.title: Luxurious Tri Living
contentBlocks.description: Introducing Kew Residence by Collingwood and GWS Football Club Legend, Heath Shaw. Here’s an impressive tri-level cul-de-sac based in the leafy and charming suburbia of Melbourne.

contentBlocks.caption: Homely Details
contentBlocks.copy: This townhouse is all about homely and chic living, achieved through a host of natural light, cosy interior details, and our designer window furnishings.

contentBlocks.caption: Sheer Softness
contentBlocks.copy: Throughout the home we see the introduction of our S Fold Sheer Curtains in Alexandra Titanium, adding to the length of the space and bringing in softness and allowing for light to filter into the room.

contentBlocks.caption: Integrated Function
contentBlocks.copy: The use of our Roller Blinds in Vivid Block BO Charcoal/Black helps ensure complete light blockout, privacy, and thermal control is achieved from room to room.

contentBlocks.caption: Clever Considerations
contentBlocks.copy: Our window furnishings are well considered in the residence, dressing up expansive voids and windows, and cleverly concealed behind built-in pelmets and high-ceilings.

contentBlocks.caption: Seamless Automation
contentBlocks.copy: Adding to the luxe living experience, seamless motorisation is added to offer elevated function in the home. Cue hands free and automated window furnishing adjustments.

contentBlocks.title: Charming Residences
contentBlocks.description: The team at PJH Constructions created two adjacent homes that are both captivating from interior to exterior. All about craftsmanship, architectural design, and effortless style - Gurya Residences are a sight to behold.

contentBlocks.caption: Sheer Introduction
contentBlocks.copy: Filled with copious amounts of natural light, Guyra Residences required functional sheers that would work to match the effortless beauty of the home.

contentBlocks.caption: Colour Cohesion
contentBlocks.copy: Offsetting the project’s warm, cosy, and vibrant palette, our Sheer Curtains in Allusion Snow were selected to complement and adorn the space.

contentBlocks.caption: Perfect Balance
contentBlocks.copy: Combining function and aesthetics into one, our Double Curtains using Sheer Curtains in Allusion Snow and Blockout Curtains in Domino White, were introduced to provide effortless privacy, light control, and assist with thermal insulation.

contentBlocks.caption: Custom Considerations
contentBlocks.copy: To further the designer look of the home, curved curtain tracks, multi-length sheers, motorisation, and built-in pelmets were added for a final, finishing touch.

contentBlocks.caption: Transformed Oasis
contentBlocks.copy: The end result? Two home’s with a mutual connection of naturally warm, chic, and highly functional interiors that promote luxurious living.

contentBlocks.title: A sophisticated renovation of a light-filled home, designed and built by Kube Constructions on Victoria’s Mornington Peninsula.
contentBlocks.description: The team set out to achieve three key objectives: to modernise the property in a sympathetic manner, create a relaxed coastal aesthetic, and strategically introduce natural light.

contentBlocks.caption: Refined Coastal Living
contentBlocks.copy: Plantation Shutters in PolyLux Pure White underpin a relaxed yet sophisticated aesthetic in this contemporary coastal home.

contentBlocks.caption: Classic Look, Modern Finish
contentBlocks.copy: Here, the look of classic shutters meets the modern quality of DIY Blinds. Meaning Aussie Made construction, durable PolyLux craftsmanship, and a 20-year warranty.

contentBlocks.caption: Optimal Natural Light
contentBlocks.copy: Through the operable louvres, natural light is able to enter individual rooms as desired. A simple tilt allows the morning sun to steam in, create ambience or block out harsh rays.

contentBlocks.caption: Soft and Tactile
contentBlocks.copy: Mornington One benefits from a cohesive selection of shutters, blinds, and curtains. Sheer curtains in Burano Talc hang close to the ceiling to invite softness, movement, and filtered light into the indoor-outdoor living space.

contentBlocks.caption: Water Resistant
contentBlocks.copy: Shutters are made from water-resistant materials, making them suitable for wet areas and areas with higher humidity. Install across an entire home for a cohesive interior scheme and a timeless design addition.

contentBlocks.title: “If you're looking for that resolved solution from start to finish with great service, DIY Blinds are perfect.”
contentBlocks.description: Marcus Elliott – Director of Kube Constructions.

contentBlocks.title: Skilfully designed by the team at Manna Made, we’re thrilled to be a part of Blairgowrie Residence and the home's breathtaking grandeur.

contentBlocks.caption: A Perfect Finish
contentBlocks.copy: Our designer window furnishings have been used to enhance each room’s purpose, personality, and palette, as well as promote function in the home.

contentBlocks.caption: Considered Designs
contentBlocks.copy: Well considered in the bedroom and the rest of the home, built-in pelmets are introduced. Giving off the appearance of S Fold Sheers falling from the ceiling. The puddling curtain finish further adds to the elegant ambience of the home and keeps the space effortlessly stylish.

contentBlocks.caption: Ease Of Access
contentBlocks.copy: In the open plan dining area our Sheer Curtains in Laconia Air Linen adorn the space, boasting multiple curtain openings to promote ease of access to the lush exterior and enviable pool space.

contentBlocks.caption: Total Functionality
contentBlocks.copy: Across the window seat and into the living room our Blockout Roller Blinds in Metro Dove/White provide complete light, privacy, and temperature control. The colour matched design keeps the furnishings subtle, and artfully concealed when completely rolled.

contentBlocks.caption: Charming Touches
contentBlocks.copy: Following a pared-back approach, the abode sees deeply considered designs, luxe finishes, and charming textures throughout the space.

contentBlocks.title: Jimmy Doo Farm is a loving reimagination of an old farmhouse turned stunning Snowy Mountain getaway.
contentBlocks.description: Designed by the talented team at Future Flip, the space boasts a deep architectural influence, featuring gabled ceilings, connected open spaces and a charming quality throughout.

contentBlocks.caption: Sheer Magic
contentBlocks.copy: Creating a warm and light-filled space for family and guests was a major design consideration for the home. To cultivate the cosy and inviting ambience, our sheer curtains work to promote abundant light and a comforting sense of airiness.

contentBlocks.caption: Privacy and Light
contentBlocks.copy: Bringing a perfect balance into the space, our sheer curtains in Allusion Rattan and roller blinds in Vivid Block White were introduced. The sheers add a warm and softening touch, while the blinds provide complete light blockout and privacy when desired.

contentBlocks.caption: Form and Function
contentBlocks.copy: Adding a touch of drama and accent to the space our sheer curtains in Cavalier Onyx (available on request via our incredible Design Consultants) are paired with our Vivid Block Charcoal/Black roller blinds. Together they check off both function and aesthetics, creating wondrous flow in the space and essential thermal insulation from the home's alpine landscape.

contentBlocks.caption: Timeless Touch
contentBlocks.copy: Furnishing the space in a moodier palette helped not only create a sophisticated feel in the home but also provide practicality to the rooms. Being a family home it was important for the window furnishings to be durable and withstand the test of time.

contentBlocks.caption: Charming Considerations
contentBlocks.copy: Nothing creates a designer look and feel in the home the way custom furnishings do. Using carefully curated window furnishings gave the home its own distinct flair and style, whilst opening up the rooms and creating a sense of space. The end result? An innately charming retreat, the perfect place to create heartfelt memories.

contentBlocks.title: Blairgowrie Two project sees the creation of an incredibly sophisticated home; teeming with warmth and wondrous charm.
contentBlocks.description: Situated amongst the beautiful scenery of Mornington Peninsula, the space boasts copious amounts of sunlight, green landscapes and a soft coastal palette.

contentBlocks.caption: Seamless Function
contentBlocks.copy: Keeping effortless function and design aesthetics at the heart of the bedroom, built-in pelmets are thoughtfully introduced through collaboration with our design consultants. This sophisticated feature perfectly conceals the sheer curtain heading and completely covers the motorised roller blinds. The result is a seamless flow in the architecture and cornices of the abode.

contentBlocks.caption: Luxurious Additions
contentBlocks.copy: As the home lavishly bathes in abundant sunlight, sheer curtains that just touch the floor are used to complement the room and dress the expansive window space. Not only are they a luxurious addition but further provide an artful solution for privacy, warmth, and light filtering.

contentBlocks.caption: Flowing Access
contentBlocks.copy: Allowing the room to expand and connect with its outdoor landscape - the sheer curtains include multiple openings, offering fluid access to the extravagant windows and sliding door that opens to the pool and alfresco space.

contentBlocks.caption: Artful Solutions
contentBlocks.copy: Achieving a designer finish, the colour-matched pelmets help give off the appearance of beautiful sheer fabrics falling from the sky. To further the space, our roller blinds are paired with motorisation, boasting luxurious convenience and effortless usability all year round.

contentBlocks.caption: Coastal Sophistication
contentBlocks.copy: Imbued with coastal charm and natural sophistication, this project has resulted in the impressive creation of Blairgowrie Two - a light-filled sanctuary we could only dream of calling home.

contentBlocks.title: We love the style of photographer turned project manager Josh Miller and his wife Steph Claire Smith, co-founder of Keep it Cleaner.
contentBlocks.description: It’s no surprise that when they renovated their private holiday retreat, the result was one of timeless beauty. Their stunning getaway effortlessly blends farmhouse flair and contemporary comfort, with luxurious window furnishings to match.

contentBlocks.caption: Capture the Light
contentBlocks.copy: Steph and Josh wanted to usher in gentle rays, diffuse harsh sunlight and frame the property’s picturesque views–all with family-friendly ease, of course. DIY Blinds motorised Laconia Air sheer linen curtains in the colour Swan ticked every box and add a softness to the space.

contentBlocks.caption: Comfort Meets Convenience
contentBlocks.copy: The couple recently became parents and knew that anything they could do to make life easy was a wise move. Their automated curtains and blinds let them control the light levels with the simple push of a button keeping the fabric spotless and the experience seamless.

contentBlocks.caption: Family-Friendly Style
contentBlocks.copy: All families know that durable window furnishings a are non-negotiable. As well as being soft and sumptuous, linen’s natural fibres are also long-lasting, making them the perfect addition to large and lively homes.

contentBlocks.caption: Dark and Dramatic
contentBlocks.copy: For the home theatre, DIY blinds colour matched Block Out Roller Blinds to the expansive walls and layered them with softening Sheer Curtains in Centennial Charcoal. Motorised blinds provide the ultimate cinematic experience with a click of the play button the blinds descend creating an immersive theatre ambience and adding a noise-dampening feat.

contentBlocks.caption: Pamper in Privacy
contentBlocks.copy: Not every room demands a view – privacy was understandably a top priority for the bathrooms, which Steph and Josh achieved with Blockout Roller Blinds. The neutral Sanctuary Plaster colour blends seamlessly into the window surround and allows for a barely-there appeal when open.

contentBlocks.caption: Bedroom Bliss
contentBlocks.copy: Light control is essential for quality sleep, not to mention luxurious weekend lie-ins! Motorised Block Out Roller Blinds in Sanctuary Plaster grace the bedroom windows, while Sheer Curtains in Laconia Air Swan continue up towards the heritage cornices to accentuate the soaring ceilings–even in rooms where the windows stop short.

contentBlocks.title: When the BuildHer8 team came together we knew this was going to be a project filled with elegance and sophistication.

contentBlocks.caption: Designed For Family Living
contentBlocks.copy: The vision was simple: create an energy-efficient home made for family living whilst balancing form and function throughout.

contentBlocks.caption: Maintaining Elegance
contentBlocks.copy: Our Allusion range; a durable-linen blend that has both an organic linen appearance and texture, was the perfect addition to the North House living area. Paired with motorisation the curtains maintain their elegant shape as it removes the need for anyone (including small kids with sticky fingers), to manually pull at the sheers.

contentBlocks.caption: Bedroom Bliss
contentBlocks.copy: Function and form are a sought-after combination in any bedroom. By filling this space with lined curtains it adds the softness of the sheers and the complete light control of blockouts. We’ve brought them together in one.

contentBlocks.caption: Tone And Texture
contentBlocks.copy: The contrast of colours and textures throughout the bathroom provide an alluring vignette from every angle. The addition of sheer curtains has created a luxe look to be desired.

contentBlocks.title: When Rebekah and the team from BuildHer Collective got in touch we knew we had to be involved. The result? An incredible collaboration that shows the impact window furnishings can have to elevate the ambience and functionality of a home.
A Curvaceous Treasure
contentBlocks.description: With crisp white curves both inside and outside the house, this home is a modern classic that won’t soon be forgotten.

contentBlocks.caption: Clever Curves
contentBlocks.copy: With a house that was all about curves, our custom curved curtain tracks were an easy choice. By taking the curtain stack around the corner and away from the wall-to-wall windows, we were able to maximise light, showcase the impressive windows and stunning architectural voids - achieving harmony with the rest of the home.

contentBlocks.caption: An Incredible Feat
contentBlocks.copy: Sheer curtains in ‘Frost’ from the Burano range extend far beyond the tops of the window, drawing your eye up and accentuating the 4.5 metre ceilings in the living area while maintaining a softness and femininity within the space.

contentBlocks.caption: The Perfect Fit
contentBlocks.copy: Sleek recessed roller blinds in ‘Ice’ from the One Block range, allow the custom sunken lounge to be the hero of the room. Choosing a motorised blind, removes the need for chains, eliminates any visual clutter and adds the benefits of complete light control at the touch of a button.

contentBlocks.caption: Alluring Street Appeal
contentBlocks.copy: The curves start before you enter the house with the instantly recognisable façade providing effortless street appeal. The white bricks are the perfect textural backdrop for the native plants in the front yard.

contentBlocks.caption: Backed By Function
contentBlocks.copy: Lined curtains provide the ultimate in form and function, maintaining the curated continuity of fabrics and textures throughout the home, while a stitched on blockout backing adds the functionality of light control required in a bedroom.

contentBlocks.caption: Gorgeous Curves
contentBlocks.copy: The soft curves of the S Fold curtain capture the light in entertaining spaces, create intimacy in a space otherwise characterised by masculine lines and void spaces.

contentBlocks.caption: A Grand Entrance
contentBlocks.copy: Curtains frame the entrance to the entertainer’s courtyard. The outdoor fireplace makes it the perfect location for outdoor events all year round.

contentBlocks.caption: A Natural Solution
contentBlocks.copy: Filtered sunlight through the Burano sheers in colour ‘Frost’, illuminate and complement the natural linen, while hiding the motorised blockout roller blinds that can be scheduled to open and close at your preferred time of day for a seamless night-time routine.

contentBlocks.caption: Subtle Sophistication
contentBlocks.copy: Floor-to-ceiling curtains highlight the height of the room, while a slight puddling of the material on the floor adds a subtle sense of sophistication without being over the top.

contentBlocks.caption: Seamless Connection
contentBlocks.copy: The Rathmines South House is all about its relationship with the outdoors, so we needed to select window furnishings that emphasise this connection. The soft greys and linen-look texture of the curtains provide a natural textural element that seamlessly transports you between the spaces.

content.value: The Light House Project at Norah Head is a project developed by homeowners and directors of Loughlin Furniture, Rob & Jess Loughlin. Situated in an idyllic location on the coast of NSW, this family home is light, bright and inviting, with lots of natural textures and earthy tones to enhance its coastal feel.

contentBlocks.caption: Complimenting Texture and Tone
contentBlocks.copy: There’s a reason the Allusion range is so sought-after in lounge and bedroom settings - they’re soft, light-filtering, delicately textured and help to create the right light for both early mornings and late afternoons.

contentBlocks.caption: Creating Blissful Moments
contentBlocks.copy: Not only filtering light, sheer curtains create daytime privacy and also adds a beautiful element that softens and brightens your space.

contentBlocks.caption: A Unique Design
contentBlocks.copy: The addition of sheers to the Light House Project elevated this beautiful breakfast nook and created a delicate and cosy feel to a unique space. Can we take a second to admire how gracefully it diffuses light in an area in need of it?

contentBlocks.caption: An Entertainers Dream
contentBlocks.copy: This large stacker door combined with our soft sheers creates a seamless connection between the indoors and out. A charming invitation for your guests to experience the best of both worlds.

contentBlocks.title: This DIY Blinds and Loughlin Furniture collaboration has resulted in an outstanding home that has Rob & Jess beyond thrilled with the outcome.
contentBlocks.description: A beautiful coastal refuge fit for any Lighthouse Keeper.

contentBlocks.title: With a renovation 10 years in the making, Susie and Brad brought their vision to life when they created their forever home in Hawthorn.

content.value: As a calming sanctuary for their growing family and a retreat from their busy lives, Susie & Brad's home was truly a unique project. The curated design and bespoke window furnishings allowed them to navigate the long sunlight hours while complementing the tone and curves of their home.

contentBlocks.caption: Minimalism with impact
contentBlocks.copy: With a streamlined appearance and a minimalist design, roller blinds are the perfect addition to this Hawthorn sanctuary. With the ability to control light, privacy, and temperature, roller blinds are a great choice for any home.

contentBlocks.caption: Functionality and Form
contentBlocks.copy: Not only are sheer curtains a showstopping addition to any entertaining space, but they also provide an element of functionality. Susie and Brad benefit from the privacy and the ability to shield themselves from the northern sun in their living areas.

contentBlocks.caption: Where design meets functionality
contentBlocks.copy: Susie and Brad included lined curtains in their home to maintain their ideal fabric & colour while gaining the functionality of blockout curtains. This let them navigate the challenge of letting in the morning or afternoon light, but reducing the heat at warmer times of the day.

contentBlocks.caption: Plan To Plan
contentBlocks.copy: Integrating your window furnishings into the pelmets can create the illusion of your blinds falling gracefully from the ceiling. Clean and minimalist with a big impact, this thoughtful detail has the power to maintain clean lines throughout your home.

content.value: “We wanted it to feel soft, organic, integrated, like we had really thought about it from the beginning. I would definitely advise to work with DIY Blinds early and think about what is the mood of the house that you want to create because blinds can make a huge difference.”

contentBlocks.title: Yolanda is the DevelopHer behind this luxuriously renovated and extended Federation home in Melbourne.

contentBlocks.caption: Packed with personality
contentBlocks.copy: Huge windows let natural light flood in, which is diffused by the dramatic linen sheers that feature throughout the home.

contentBlocks.caption: Luxe details
contentBlocks.copy: Concrete, timber and exposed brick finishes are juxtaposed with polished nickel, brass and Italian white crystal.

contentBlocks.caption: Add drama to any room
contentBlocks.copy: You can’t have enough natural light in a home. Sheers are perfect for filtering light and adding a touch of drama.

contentBlocks.title: Dynamic duo Jess and Matt run successful design and build business, Chamberlain Property. Their two sleek Templestowe townhouses are sumptuous yet superbly functional family homes.
In Templestowe Townhouse 1 light and airy sheer curtains soften the crisp white walls, natural stone and hardwood finishes.

contentBlocks.caption: Daytime privacy
contentBlocks.copy: The sheers are tactile, filter light in the most incredible way and create daytime privacy.

contentBlocks.title: Templestowe Townhouse 2 has a completely different floor plan and look and feel to its neighbour, but it’s equally lust worthy.

contentBlocks.caption: Laidback drama
contentBlocks.copy: Linen sheers add laidback drama in the kitchen and living spaces. The home features a bold green kitchen, soothing grey tones and brass accents for warmth.

contentBlocks.caption: Stop the heat escaping
contentBlocks.copy: Blockout roller blinds are installed behind the sheers for light control, privacy and thermal insulation. Linen sheers create a warm, cosy vibe in the bedrooms.

contentBlocks.title: "Our linen sheers add softness and perfectly complement the sophisticated colour palette of Townhouse 2."

content.value: "When preparing to sell a home, choose luxe
sheers
for hero spaces like living rooms and master bedrooms. They help buyers feel emotionally connected to the property."
Blockout roller blinds
work hard to provide light control, nighttime privacy and thermal insulation.

contentBlocks.title: Meet Arcos. A jaw-dropping Mediterranean villa-inspired home by Graya and Joe Adsett Architects.
contentBlocks.description: ARCOS is a spacious family home that's perfect for entertaining friends and family. It features a breathtaking pool, generous backyard and incredible details like the curved central staircase and dramatic arched entrance.

contentBlocks.caption: Dreamy linen sheer curtains
contentBlocks.copy: Rob and Meghan carefully researched and planned all their furniture and material choices, including their window furnishings. The linen sheers add a soft, relaxed feel and perfectly complement the warm, neutral colour palette. Read more about ARCOS on our blog.

contentBlocks.caption: Effortless luxury with motorisation
contentBlocks.copy: The street-facing sitting room at Arcos features floor-to-ceiling sheers from our Allusion range, colour linen. For effortless luxury, privacy and thermal insulation, Rob and Meghan installed Somfy-powered motorised blockout roller blinds behind their sheers.

contentBlocks.caption: Thermal insulation
contentBlocks.copy: The motorised blockout roller blinds behind the sheers in the bedrooms are from our Balmoral range, which is fantastic for thermal insulation all year round. In winter they stop heat escaping and block cold draughts. In summer they reflect the harsh Aussie sun and help keep your home cool. Read more about ARCOS on our blog.

contentBlocks.caption: Soft and tactile
contentBlocks.copy: The sheers at ARCOS are soft and tactile and invite you to approach the windows and walk out onto the terrace. They diffuse the bright sunlight and add texture to the minimalist living spaces. They stack easily to the side when the couple wants to enjoy their amazing city views.

contentBlocks.title: Sheer linen curtains add drama and softness to the perfectly monochromatic design of Taf and Bree's new home, Three Gables.

contentBlocks.caption: Add drama with sheer linen curtains
contentBlocks.copy: Our sheer linen curtains play a massive role in softening the space, adding drama and bringing everything together. The pale grey sheers complement the contrasting black and white colour palette, and they look incredible against harder surfaces like the timber, concrete and even the wool. On our blog read about the design and build of Taf and Bree's new home, and how their vision became a beautiful reality.

contentBlocks.caption: Keep it simple and neutral.
contentBlocks.copy: Sheer curtains are already a huge statement, so we recommend going for a fabric that doesn’t overpower the rest of the home.

content.value: Choose a texture you're already using in your home. Our home is full of natural materials including linen, so
linen sheers
were an obvious choice.
Window furnishings complete a home and need to have more importance within the building industry, not just the styling and decorating industry.
Link your curtain colour with your furniture and carpet fabrics, to make the connection with the rest of the house.

contentBlocks.title: She Builds Interiors is about making a big impact in our clients' homes through carefully considered interior design, build and styling.

contentBlocks.caption: Brilliant PolyLux® plantation shutters
contentBlocks.copy: I've had a love affair with plantation shutters for a long time! They go brilliantly with the palette and my design ethic externally and internally, they don’t date, are becoming increasingly popular and were the best choice space-wise and for ease of maintenance. On the blog we talk to Lisa Kefford from She Builds Interiors about all things design, the incredible community of fellow BuildHers and why she loves plantation shutters.

contentBlocks.caption: Aussie made plantation shutters
contentBlocks.copy: I like that all DIY Blinds products are made in Australia. That resonates with me and my values. I like to support local and Australian businesses when and where I can.

contentBlocks.title: This is Living

content.value: We first fell in love with Kyal and Kara when they appeared on The Block and have loved following their progress. Now we watch them undertake their first knock-down rebuild with the fabulous Blue Lagoon beachside family home. With their living, dining and kitchen space, Kyal and Kara have created a true heart of the home. Not only is this a space for family and friends to hang out, it also connects to every other area in the home.

contentBlocks.caption: Heart of the home
contentBlocks.copy: Being the emotional and physical heart of the home, this large open plan area needed design elements that help connect all the rooms together. Kara chose materials that had been used in other rooms for a sense of cohesiveness. This meant oak cabinetry to match the bathrooms, a soft sandy colour palette and large windows dressed in our sheer designer curtains.

contentBlocks.caption: Curtains that open like magic
contentBlocks.copy: This fantastic open plan area screams both functionality and design – so what better addition than motorised curtains! The entire kitchen was designed around multi-tasking, and now with just the press of a button (or a quick “Hey Google”), you can be preparing dinner and close the curtains without taking a single step.

content.value: The combination of oak and white cabinetry is perfect for the coastal colour scheme and also draw a connection with the same timber used throughout different rooms in the home.
Large windows with sweeping sheer curtains, in colour Marizpan from our Allusion range, give a soft yet elegant touch to the entry.
By installing curtains along the length of the wall, beyond the limits of individual windows, the space feels bigger and grander, while the soft linen-look curtains provide an earthy-luxe feel.

With friends, family, kids and pets, it’s important to choose materials that will be long-lasting and durable. Our curtains and blinds are Australian made, and our Allusion range of materials is made from a linen-cotton-poly blend so you can have a linen-look with added durability.

contentBlocks.title: Let’s Dive In!

content.value: We first fell in love with Kyal and Kara when they appeared on The Block and have loved following their progress. Now we watch them undertake their first knock-down rebuild with the fabulous Blue Lagoon beachside family home. This time, the duo really dived into the Blue Lagoon, tackling the pool, laundry and mudroom, powder room, main bathroom and guest bedroom. While these may seem like a lot of different spaces, Kara works her design magic to make them all feel connected to each other and the rest of the house.

contentBlocks.caption: Australian Coastal Meets Mediterranean Villa
contentBlocks.copy: The key to creating a sense of continuity throughout a home is to choose a theme and stick to it – but this doesn’t have to mean creating a series of identical spaces. Kyal and Kara’s Australian coastal meets Mediterranean villa theme allows for plenty of different colours and textures, that play out differently in different spaces but with a few key elements connecting them – here this means our sheer designer curtains from the Allusion range in Marzipan in most, but not all, rooms.

contentBlocks.caption: Cool, Calm, and Collected
contentBlocks.copy: Designing a home is plenty of fun, but once you’ve found your theme it’s time to stick with it. But that doesn’t mean it all has to look identical. Try and find a few pieces, colours or textures that connect different living zones together. It might be a pop of colour, the same wood used throughout the home, or the same fabric for your curtains – even when using slightly different colours; the result is a cohesive home, just like Kyal and Kara’s Blue Lagoon.

content.value: This home’s stunning theme emphasises textures and natural colours. Our sheer curtains provide privacy in the bedroom but still let in plenty of natural light that highlights the material of this linen bedspread.

The natural textures continue throughout the room with an upholstered bedhead, wool carpet and wooden bedframe and side tables. Our Allusion range give you a linen look and feel with added durability with a linen-cotton-poly blend for a look that will last.

The focus on textures continues with extra-large travertine tiles for the bathroom walls and oak cabinetry completing the look, while arched mirrors continue the theme on soft curves found in other areas of the house, including the staircase and pool.
Proving that laundries can be more than just functional, this space nails the coastal and Mediterranean vibe with eucalyptus-blue tiles.
The powder room brings together elements from the laundry, with coastal blue tones, and from the main bathroom, with a cohesive inset sink.

contentBlocks.title: A Loft of Fun

content.value: We first fell in love with Kyal and Kara when they appeared on The Block and have loved following their progress. Now we watch them undertake their first knock-down rebuild with the fabulous Blue Lagoon beachside family home. And the focus on family has never been more evident than in the designs for the kids’ bedroom, the toy room and, of course the dual-level rumpus room. All three rooms prioritise fun above all else, while still providing plenty of functional elements and while keeping with Kyal and Kara’s luxe coastal style.

contentBlocks.caption: Stairway to Kid's Heaven
contentBlocks.copy:
While the downstairs area in the rumpus room focuses on family time, the upstairs loft is all about the kids. And while you may think that the exposed beams or large windows are the hero of the space, in this room, it’s all about the helical staircase.

Windows on both sides of this large, bright room are dressed with our S Fold sheer curtains in Marzipan from the Allusion range, with the gentle folds in the curtains mirroring the curves in the staircase.

contentBlocks.caption: Focus on Fun
contentBlocks.copy: If transforming a second kid’s bedroom into a dedicated toy room doesn’t scream fun and family, then we don’t know what does. The kids’ bedroom and the toy room have distinct difference but find harmony in similar design features including wood panelling in both rooms and sheer curtains that create a youthful, soft light. The use of Marzipan sheers in Allusion match the choice in the rumpus room and create a sense of cohesion throughout the three spaces.

content.value: With large windows on both sides of the room, light plays an important aspect in this room. Sheers were the perfect choice, creating a soft light on both sides of the room that highlights design features.
With essentially two ceiling heights above the sofa, Kyal and Kara chose a soft white that matches their paint colour to create a sense of unity.

In a room with so many heroes, these pale sheer curtains in Marizpan from the Allusion range, create the perfect textural backdrop that work as well with the coastal colour palette as they would in any home.

Our Allusion range is great for common areas like this rumpus room. The material uses 54% linen and is woven for cotton and a small amount of polyester for a luxe, natural looking fabric with extra durability that is perfect for high use areas.

The combination of sheers and block out roller blinds works as well in the kids’ room as it would in any bedroom. The minimalist block out blind is ideal for sleep ins, while the sheers add a soft textural element and also provide privacy.
The neutral colour choices are ideal for rooms that may change. When the toy room eventually becomes another bedroom, the timeless curtains won’t need an update.

Our sheer curtains from the Alexandra range, colour Smoke is perfect for this kids bunk room. A great durable material which complements the colour palette of the room, but will the durability you expect from a polyester fabric.

contentBlocks.title: The Hideout

content.value: We first fell in love with Kyal and Kara when they appeared on The Block and have loved following their progress. Now we watch them undertake their first knock-down rebuild with the fabulous Blue Lagoon beachside family home. Every family home needs a luxurious parents retreat, so Kyal and Kara have turned the master bedroom into an oasis of their own.

contentBlocks.caption: Master Oasis
contentBlocks.copy: Tucked away on the second story, this master bedroom feels like so much more than just a place to rest. With windows being such an important feature in the home, floor-to-ceiling curtains became an important design element in this luxurious retreat.

contentBlocks.caption: When two is better than one
contentBlocks.copy: Kyal and Kara get the best of both worlds with double curtains for total control over light and privacy in their bedroom. Blockout curtains in Antsey stone, block out as much light as possible for long weekend lie-ins, while sheer curtains in Alexandra smoke provide a subtle diffused light that gently accentuates the other textures in the room and providing the perfect match for this coastal colour scheme.

content.value: Did we mention these beautiful and functional double curtains are motorised? Kyal and Kara have utilised our motorised curtain tracks from Somfy. The Somfy Glydea curtain track system provides zero touch interaction via remote control or even voice assistant for a truly future proofed solution.

Double curtains are a luxurious and functional addition to any master suite. The luxe look and softness of our Alexandra sheers, paired with the full blockout functionality of our Anstey curtains are a designers dream.

contentBlocks.title: Be Our Guest

content.value: We first fell in love with Kyal and Kara when they appeared on The Block and have loved following their progress. Now we watch them undertake their first knock-down rebuild with the fabulous Blue Lagoon beachside family home. Family extends beyond just their immediate household though, so the Blue Lagoon features a studio out the back for guests. The compact yet inviting space is perfect for holidays with a hotel feel that still retains some of the old beach shack charm.

contentBlocks.caption: Warm and Inviting
contentBlocks.copy: Kyal and Kara chose a warm colour palette for their studio guesthouse that creates an inviting atmosphere, complemented by bright whites and lots of natural textures for beachside vibes.

contentBlocks.caption: Beyond Windows
contentBlocks.copy: Who ever said curtains had to go on windows? Kyal and Kara expertly break the rules, using our Aurora dimout curtains as a room divider over a stunning arch that separates the living and dining area maximising space and natural light.

content.value: Located close to the street, airy sheers in Alexandra, colour Smoke provide daytime privacy and a beautiful diffused light on sunny days, while minimalistic
blockout roller blinds
provide added functionality without compromising on style.
Proving that
curtains
aren’t just for windows, our dimout curtains in Aurora provide a textural and functional room divider.
Soft
roman blinds
in matching Aurora material complement the floor-to-ceiling curtains in a smaller space. This is a custom solution we can provide a quote for.
Our dimout
curtains
in Aurora allow just enough light through so the stunning arch is still a feature, even with the curtains drawn.
Linen curtains provide the perfect texture to complement natural features like stone and wood, while the colour choice is the perfect pair with these clay-look tiles.

contentBlocks.title: Modern Modernism

content.value: This brand new family home is an instant classic, mixing mid-century geometric shapes with modern tones for a timeless result. Backed by a stellar team of professionals including JBM Builders, designer Melissa Vukadin and interior stylist Kimberley Baker and of course DIY Blinds, the home combines textures with a soft yet minimal palette for a tranquil sanctuary.

contentBlocks.caption: Textures and Tones
contentBlocks.copy: The key to the success of this home was Melissa’s ability to combine different textures with a minimal colour palette. This allows the geometric features of the home, like these floor-to-ceiling tiles to stand out, while our S Fold sheer curtains offer a diffused light that pairs with a muted palette to soften the overall feel of the room.

contentBlocks.caption: Forget the spotlight, it’s all about natural light
contentBlocks.copy: Sheer S Fold curtains from our Audiance range, in 'Natural' colour, were the ideal choice for this modern family home. The diffused natural light softens harsher textures while also highlighting and enhancing the combinations of textures. The sophisticated muted palette adds to the effect for an unforgettable residence.

content.value: The careful selection of colours and textures continues to the kitchen where cabinetry mirrors the flooring, table and staircase, while the walls, ceiling and curtains remain the same shade of white to highlight the pale yet warm wood grain.
Our
sheer curtains
in Audiance Natural, provide privacy and texture while still allowing plenty of natural light to stream into the home, highlighting and enhancing the individual textures.

Natural light has an ability to highlight natural textures like a stone and wood in a way that synthetic light just can’t match. When choosing window furnishings consider how much light you want to allow in, not just how much light to keep out.
S Fold curtains
provide a soft textured backdrop with neutral colours that allow your hero pieces to pop.
The Audiance Natural
S Fold curtains
mirror the wall colour almost perfectly for a seamless experience in the stunning double-height living area.
The mainly muted colour scheme allows for drama with the occasional pop of darker tones.
Parted
sheer curtains
reveal the simple yet luxurious plunge pool. The perfect partnership of muted tones and natural textures continues to the outside where sleek lines take centre stage.
This home’s study in texture and tones proves that all white is anything but boring.

contentBlocks.title: Armadale Edwardian

content.value: First-time builder, Ivy Huang’s renovation has transformed this weatherboard Edwardian into one of Melbourne’s most sought after properties. “I wanted to create a beautiful, functional family home that would also feel like we were on holidays all the time!”. Ivy combined her engineering background with professional project manager skills along with help from the talented team at BuildHer Collective to bring to life this “sanctuary” in the heart of Armadale.

contentBlocks.caption: Edwardian Drama
contentBlocks.copy: The home celebrates many existing heritage features, while seamlessly incorporating modern luxuries for a true dream home. The timeless feel of DIY Blinds’ products used for this home help continue this respectful modernization with PolyLux Shutters in the bedroom while the use of sheers in the bathroom create drama and highlight the statement bathtub.

contentBlocks.caption: Bathroom Sheer
contentBlocks.copy: Pushing the boundaries of furnishings for a bathroom, Ivy made a bold statement in this statement bathroom with Morton Blanc sheer curtains. Including a black Vanda rod with the sheer curtains allows the black accents of the bath, chandelier and fixings to be accentuated by the curtain rod.

Privacy never looked so good! DIY Blinds’ Aurora linen curtains provide functional privacy with a touch of luxe from the natural linen texture. The pale linen paired with the Black Vanda curtain rod makes for a memorable design statement. Simple juxtapositions like this work to heighten design elements and also serve to highlight additional dark accent colours within the space.

content.value: This beautiful bathroom complements the period elements of the home with subtle statements in the form of a modern colour palette and fixings. DIY Blinds’ Australian Made
PolyLux shutters
provide functional light and privacy control as well as yet another design element in this already elegant space.
Privacy never looked so good! DIY Blinds’ Aurora linen
curtains

provide functional privacy with a touch of luxe from the natural linen texture. The pale linen paired with the Black Vanda curtain rod makes for a memorable design statement. Simple juxtapositions like this work to heighten design elements and also serve to highlight additional dark accent colours within the space.
A match made in heaven. These heritage windows look incredible and provide amazing curb appeal. Pair these ornate windows with Australian Made
PolyLux Shutters
and your external appeal matches the incredible interior of this bedroom.

contentBlocks.title: A Design Masterclass

content.value: The Designory’s director Melissa Bonney had a vision for The Barefoot Villa. She wanted to create a luxurious getaway with the soul of a home. Melissa says, “We filled this home with carefully curated selections from businesses we really believe in. The home is as much a testament to them as it is to our design team…”. Discover the DIY Blinds range used to achieve Melissa’s vision.

contentBlocks.caption: Let there be light
contentBlocks.copy: Filled with skylights and louvred windows, The Barefoot Villa’s design is all about letting in as much light as possible. Sheer curtains help create privacy without losing the natural light the team worked so hard to incorporate into the design.

contentBlocks.caption: The perfect blend
contentBlocks.copy: Our Aesop range was the perfect choice for The Designory’s luxurious holiday home. The 50-50 linen-poly blend allows for a durable finish without compromising on the style and luxury that linen provides, while the choice of sheers in parchment create a perfect backdrop that works with design elements in every room.

content.value: Nothing says coastal luxury quite like
sheer curtains
. The ripples of the light-weight fabric create an easy-going atmosphere while providing necessary privacy to bedrooms and living areas.
These
sheer curtains
from our Aesop range are made from a linen-poly blend, giving the look of natural linen curtains with the durability and low maintenance of synthetic material.
Slim and subtle,
blockout roller blinds
hide behind
sheer curtains
allowing for long holiday lie-ins without compromising on style. The Barefoot Villa combines Aesop sheer curtains in parchment and blockout blinds in natural from the Kew range.
Neutral finishes, like these
sheer curtains
from our Aesop range in parchment, create a timeless design and allow the décor to take centre stage. With neutral and natural backdrops, The Barefoot Villa will always stay fresh and modern.
By running
sheer curtains
along the full length of the wall, rather than finishing where the window does, The Designory has made this living area feel larger, creating a seamless flow from kitchen to dining to living zones.
Even louvred windows need to close eventually.
Sheer curtains
paired with
blockout roller blinds
allow plenty of room for the windows to be opened and add to the luxury coastal feel.

contentBlocks.title: Northcote Luxury

content.value: BuildHer Collective believe that with the “right tools anyone can build” but it takes a special team to create a home as stunning as their Bayview House. BuildHer took full advantage of DIY Blinds’ products and services to create this luxurious family home.

contentBlocks.caption: Custom Creations
contentBlocks.copy: Proving that rules were made to be broken, BuildHer Collective ordered these two-toned custom-made designer curtains from DIY Blinds. They worked alongside our team to handpick material from Warwick Fabrics and lifted the matte black curtain rail above the top of the windows to highlight those high Victorian ceilings.

contentBlocks.caption: Motorised Curtains
contentBlocks.copy: Experience hands-free living with smart curtains. At the touch of a button or a quick query to Alexa, watch your blinds or curtains glide open like magic. Set them to automatically open in the morning so you wake up to natural light, or use them as added security so it looks like someone’s at home – you’ll wonder how you lived without them. Motorise any curtain and blind including these sheer curtains in Jilliby.

content.value: For homes with period features, it’s hard to go past
PolyLux Plantation Shutters
. They provide added street appeal, plenty of privacy and excellent thermal insulation.
Floor-to-ceiling windows and doors help to bring the outdoors in, but when it’s time for something a bit more intimate
sheer curtains
can create a soft light that elevates natural textures like stone and wood.
Don’t be afraid to stand-out. These custom-made two-toned
designer curtains
are effortlessly eye-catching and match the statement skirting for a cohesive look.
It’s the details that create a home. Take time to picture how different elements, textures, materials and tones work together to turn every space into your personal sanctuary.

contentBlocks.title: Fitzroy’s mix of terrace houses and industrial warehouses come together in this inner-city house by Red Door Project’s Dan and Dani. Discover the DIY Blinds used throughout this texture focused home.

contentBlocks.caption: Industrial Warmth
contentBlocks.copy: Choosing a monochromatic palette requires extra attention to be paid to the textures in a room. Here Dan and Dani have chosen Designer Curtains with an S-Fold. The texture contrasts perfectly with the industrial windows, and matches the warmth of the bed linen to create a cosy and warm atmosphere.

contentBlocks.caption: Multiple Blinds, Seamless Design
contentBlocks.copy: Create a seamless look throughout your house by using PolyLux® Plantation Shutters where possible and Visionwood Venetian Blinds in rooms shutters won't fit.

content.value: Blockout
Designer Curtains
add warmth and texture to both sides of the window, making them ideal choices for internal as well as external windows.
Venetian Blinds
are the ideal solution for slim spaces, allowing natural light through whilst maintaining privacy. Visionwood Venetian Blinds are ideal for humid rooms like the kitchen, bathroom and laundry.
The
Designer Curtain
range lets you choose your preferred colour, fold and thickness to match your aesthetic and lifestyle.
Venetian Blinds
offer the privacy needed for inner city living, whilst still allowing natural light to steam in throughout the day.

contentBlocks.title: Julia & Sasha’s Little Willow project revitalised an old gardener’s cottage on Melbourne’s Ripponlea estate. The feminine cottage blends Edwardian charm with modern convenience.

contentBlocks.caption: Everyday Luxury
contentBlocks.copy: Little Willow is full of little luxuries that hint at old world charm. Julia & Sasha used a mix of PolyLux® Plantation Shutters, Sheer Designer Curtains and Light Filtering Roller Blinds to create the perfect feel and amount of light in every room.

contentBlocks.caption: Edwardian Charm
contentBlocks.copy: This Edwardian cottage has been given a new lease on life with feminine touches and a timeless design that will last at least another 100 years.

content.value: Julia & Sasha chose a face-fit for their
Roller Blinds
but with a pelmet with matching fabric to hide the brackets and blinds.
Flowy and feminine
Sheer Designer Curtains

were the perfect choice in this bedroom. The S-Fold curtains have warm tones with just a slight hint of dusty pink that fills the room with soft filtered light and contrast beautifully with the black curtain rod.
Light Filtering Roller Blinds
shield the open plan living area from the western afternoon sun. These blinds allow diffused light through without darkening the room so you can still enjoy the daylight.
Julia & Sasha chose a face-fit for their
Roller Blinds
but with a pelmet with matching fabric to hide the brackets and blinds.
Flowy and feminine
Sheer Designer Curtains

were the perfect choice in this bedroom. The S-Fold curtains have warm tones with just a slight hint of dusty pink that fills the room with soft filtered light and contrast beautifully with the black curtain rod.
Light Filtering Roller Blinds
shield the open plan living area from the western afternoon sun. These blinds allow diffused light through without darkening the room so you can still enjoy the daylight.

contentBlocks.title: This boutique holiday rental was created by The Designory, with a contemporary coastal palette completed with natural textures for a boho feel.

contentBlocks.caption: A Mix of Textures
contentBlocks.copy: With a focus on texture Designer Curtains were the perfect fit for The Barefoot Bay Cottage. By hanging them high above the window, the room feels large and spacious.

contentBlocks.caption: Hidden Secrets
contentBlocks.copy: At first glance the bathroom appears as a relaxing retreat with PolyLux® Plantation Shutters providing privacy and adding to the coastal theme. However behind the flowing Designer Curtains is a full laundry that can be hidden in an instant and still on trend.

content.value: The Barefoot Bay Cottage uses different textures to create contrast. The hard stone in the kitchen bench and rendered walls creates a dramatic effect, whilst sage green panelled cabinetry add soft colour.
The contemporary coastal palette starts outside and works its way in with navy and sage tones, pared with natural textures like wood and stone - echoed inside with
Designer Curtains
with woven fabric.
The navy feature stands out against the remaining white walls.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
in pure white look seamless against the wall so the focus remains on the leather bedhead and navy wall.

The Barefoot Bay Cottage uses different textures to create contrast. The hard stone in the kitchen bench and rendered walls creates a dramatic effect, whilst sage green panelled cabinetry add soft colour.
The contemporary coastal palette starts outside and works its way in with navy and sage tones, pared with natural textures like wood and stone - echoed inside with
Designer Curtains
with woven fabric.
The navy feature stands out against the remaining white walls.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
in pure white look seamless against the wall so the focus remains on the leather bedhead and navy wall.

contentBlocks.title: Bec and George’s Melbourne style is highlighted in this project with lots of contrasting colours and textures used in their signature look. See which DIY Blinds’ products worked best in each space.

contentBlocks.caption: Back to Black
contentBlocks.copy: Bold and modern, this dark living area exudes sophistication. Black can come across as a cool, cold tone but with textured Designer Curtains and rugs, the space is as inviting as it is sophisticated.

contentBlocks.caption: Warmth Creation
contentBlocks.copy: Designer Curtains are the prefect solution to adding texture and softness to a room. As with Light Filtering Roller Blinds, it diffuses natural sunlight, creating warmth and also providing privacy at the same time.

content.value: The sheer white
Designer Curtains
and kid's blackboard continue the Beaconsfield House's contrasting theme whilst providing both privacy and light.
Don't be afraid to play with colours and create a bold statement. Full-length
Designer Curtains
create a statement, whilst
Roller Blinds
provide a perfectly functional solution for smaller window.
This study nook feels bright and airy thanks to
Roller Blinds
that practically disappear with a recessed installation. The light filtering design to let you take full advantage of the natural light whilst enjoying privacy.
The sheer white
Designer Curtains
and kid's blackboard continue the Beaconsfield House's contrasting theme whilst providing both privacy and light.
Don't be afraid to play with colours and create a bold statement. Full-length
Designer Curtains
create a statement, whilst
Roller Blinds
provide a perfectly functional solution for smaller window.
This study nook feels bright and airy thanks to
Roller Blinds
that practically disappear with a recessed installation. The light filtering design to let you take full advantage of the natural light whilst enjoying privacy.

contentBlocks.title: Melbourne renovators, Bec & George, have given new life to this Spotswood house. See how the pair use DIY Blinds' PolyLux® Plantation Shutters in every room in this house.

contentBlocks.caption: Shutters for Every Room
contentBlocks.copy: Bec and George created a seamless look throughout this Spotswood house by using shutters in every room. PolyLux® Plantation Shutters can be used in any room, including humid rooms like kitchens, bathrooms and the laundry, so they're a great choice for the entire home.

contentBlocks.caption: From Mid-Century to Modern
contentBlocks.copy: This renovation perfectly marries traditional features with contemporary style, and PolyLux® Plantation Shutters help realise this vision.

content.value: By installing shutters in the master bedroom and the ensuite, Bec and George created a seamless look throughout the space.
While the front bedrooms are original, the kitchen is bright and modern.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
provide a timeless solution that works with both new and old features.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
makes a statement inside and out. The horizontal lines of the shutters complement the white weather board perfectly. Just tilt the shutters for increased privacy.
By installing shutters in the master bedroom and the ensuite, Bec and George created a seamless look throughout the space.
While the front bedrooms are original, the kitchen is bright and modern.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
provide a timeless solution that works with both new and old features.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
makes a statement inside and out. The horizontal lines of the shutters complement the white weather board perfectly. Just tilt the shutters for increased privacy.

contentBlocks.title: Renovators Josh and Jenna’s design aesthetic focuses on texture, subdued colour palettes with exceptional joinery. See how DIY Blinds help realise their vision in the Maidstone project.

contentBlocks.caption: Linear Luxury
contentBlocks.copy: The couple's focus on joinery means clean lines featuring throughout the property. PolyLux® plantation shutters are the perfect choice, adding to and complementing the design.

contentBlocks.caption: Textures and Tones
contentBlocks.copy: With a woven finish, Blockout Designer Curtains add texture and work seamlessly with existing woven materials. All you need to do is choose the perfect tone for your home.

content.value: Street facing bedrooms require more privacy than the average room. The combination of
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
and Sheer
Designer Curtains
provide the ultimate solution, allowing light in while adding texture and warmth to the room.
PolyLux® Plantation Shutters
allow light into the kitchen while providing a durable solution that are an ideal choice in hot and humid rooms.
These Sheer
Designer Curtains
hang above and below the windows, creating the impression of a larger window and making the space feel more open.
Designer Curtains

help designate the living area as a warm inviting space with soft textured rugs and couches. They complement and help separate different living zones compared to the kitchen with its functional Plantation Shutters and harder surfaces.
To match the rest of the house's subdued colour palette, Josh and Jenna chose Blockout
Designer Curtains
in Anstey Latte; a warm brown tone with hints of dusty pink.

Kyal and Kara’s light and bright renovation in New South Wales took nine months to transform the former beach house into the masterpiece it is today. See how the pair used DIY Blinds in every room of the house to maintain their “Palm Springs meets long Jetty” aesthetic without compromising on functionality.

contentBlocks.caption: Luxurious Finish with Hidden Functionality
contentBlocks.copy: S-Fold Sheer Curtains from DIY Blinds’ Designer Curtains range to showcase the height of the windows in the master bedroom, while the luxurious soft sheer finish adds to the different textures in the room. Remote controlled block out blinds have been recessed into the roof for full functionality that maintains the coastal aesthetic.

contentBlocks.caption: Window Dressing that Won't Feel the Heat
contentBlocks.copy: DIY Blinds' PolyLux planation shutters provide designer solution for privacy while still allowing lots of natural light and most importantly can stand up to the heat and humidity of a bathroom.

content.value: With no cords to pull or trailing fabric,
PolyLux Plantation Shutters
are an ideal choice for kids rooms and require very little maintenance to keep looking their best.
Bathroom window dressing can be difficult to find.
PolyLux plantation shutters
complement the sophisticated coastal interiors while providing plenty of natural light and privacy.
For the front two bedrooms in the original part of the Long Jetty House, Kyal and Kara used
Designer Curtains
to provide privacy from the street and complement traditional elements including cornices and wall panelling
Plantation shutters are simple to adjust to allow more or less light into a room. Simply tilt the shutters for the perfect angle and amount of light, swing them open for a completely sunlit room.
Designer Curtains
maintain privacy while adding a pop of texture to your facade and improving street appeal.
